webwork-tex.statement: Use the chain rule to find \(\frac{dz}{dt}\), where \[z = x^2 y + x y^2,\quad x = 5 + t^4,\quad y = 5 - t^6\] \leavevmode\\\relax First the pieces: \leavevmode\\\relax \leavevmode\\\relax \(\frac{\partial z}{\partial x} =\) \mbox{\parbox[t]{15ex}{\hrulefill}} \leavevmode\\\relax \(\frac{\partial z}{\partial y} =\) \mbox{\parbox[t]{15ex}{\hrulefill}} \leavevmode\\\relax \(\frac{dx}{dt} =\) \mbox{\parbox[t]{15ex}{\hrulefill}} \leavevmode\\\relax \(\frac{dy}{dt} =\) \mbox{\parbox[t]{15ex}{\hrulefill}} \leavevmode\\\relax \leavevmode\\\relax End result (in terms of just \(t\)): \leavevmode\\\relax \(\frac{dz}{dt} =\) \mbox{\parbox[t]{30ex}{\hrulefill}}
